intro: Dubyaea pteroponda, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late summer and early autumn. Dubyaea pteroponda is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
